PhD student in the department of Electronic Structure of Materials, Radboud University Nijmegen, Netherlands.
Working Fields: Computational Physics, Simulation and Modeling in Material Science, Spectroscopy of materials.
Expertise: DFT calculations (codes VASP and Wien2k).
ACADEMIC SKILLS:
●  High proficiency in Fortran programming, and basic use of C++. 
●  High proficiency in softwares: Origin, Gnuplot, Mathematica, and Microsoft Office.
●  Good  English in reading, writing, speaking and listening.

publications.name: Antiferromagnetic S=1/2 Spin Chain Driven by p-Orbital Ordering in CsO2;

authors.headline: PhD student at Radboud University Nijmegen

profile_positions.description:
During the past 4.5 years as a PhD student, I focused on theoretical work, such as modeling and simulation. 
● In cooperation with the Solid-State Materials for Electronics group in University of Groningen, I explored the 2p magnetism in di-oxygen anion based molecular solids: I investigate the orbital ordering and one dimensional spin chain property in CsO2 with low temperature structure, Raman spectra and magnetism in the mixed-valence K-Ba sesquioxide (KxBa1-xO2), they all can promote new research in the field of 2p magnetism.
● In cooperation with the Novel Magnetic Materials Lab of Toyama Prefectural University in Japan, I explored the low temperature anomaly in  half-metallic NiMnSb: I give a reasonable microscopic mechanism to the mysterious low temperature anomaly which has puzzled researchers in the filed of half-metal for more than 30 years.

● In cooperation with the Solid-State Materials for Electronics group in University of Groningen and the geophysics department in Utrecht University, I explored a new route in spintronic device design: In spinorbitronics, the direction of the magnetization in a material controls its conduction property by use of spin-orbit interaction in it, such as greigite (Fe3S4). Here, the magneto-resistance is from relativistic effect, while the spin-orbit interaction in GMR device is detrimental.
